description: You can use the Google Calendar API to find and view public calendar events. If you're authorized, you can also access and modify private calendars and events on those calendars. Use the Google Calendar API to achieve deeper integration with Google Calendar. Mobile apps, Web apps, and other systems can create, display, or sync with Calendar data.
steps: Click Continue to enable the API.
On the Credentials page, get an API key (and set the API key restrictions).

Browse to https://accounts.google.com/o/oauth2/v2/auth?client_id=CLIENT_ID&redirect_uri=REDIRECT_URI&response_type=token&scope=https://www.googleapis.com/auth/calendar+https://www.googleapis.com/auth/calendar.readonly, where CLIENT_ID is you apiKey and REDIRECT_URI is the redirect url you set up in your credentials
Log in or choose an account
Click ALLOW to provide permissions to your application
Get access token from the URL you have been redirected to

blocks.name: getAccessToken
blocks.description: Exchange code for access token.

args.name: clientId
args.info: The client ID that you obtain from the API Console, as described in Obtain OAuth 2.0 credentials.

args.name: clientSecret
args.info: The client secret that you obtain from the API Console, as described in Obtain OAuth 2.0 credentials.

args.name: code
args.info: The authorization code that is returned from the initial request.

args.name: redirectUri
args.info: The URI that you specify in the API Console, as described in Set a redirect URI.

args.name: grantType
args.info: This field must contain a value of authorization_code, as defined in the OAuth 2.0 specification.

blocks.name: deleteACL
blocks.description: Deletes an access control rule.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: calendarId
args.info: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the `primary` keyword.

args.name: ruleId
args.info: ACL rule identifier.

blocks.name: getSingleACL
blocks.description: Returns an access control rule.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: calendarId
args.info: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the `primary` keyword.

args.name: ruleId
args.info: ACL rule identifier.

blocks.name: createACL
blocks.description: Creates an access control rule.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: calendarId
args.info: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the `primary` keyword.

args.name: role
args.info: The role assigned to the scope. Possible values are: `none` - Provides no access. `freeBusyReader` - Provides read access to free/busy information. `reader` - Provides read access to the calendar. Private events will appear to users with reader access, but event details will be hidden. `writer` - Provides read and write access to the calendar. Private events will appear to users with writer access, and event details will be visible. `owner` - Provides ownership of the calendar. This role has all of the permissions of the writer role with the additional ability to see and manipulate ACLs.

args.name: scopeType
args.info: The type of the scope. Possible values are: `default` - The public scope. This is the default value. `user` - Limits the scope to a single user. `group` - Limits the scope to a group. `domain` - Limits the scope to a domain.

args.name: scopeValue
args.info: The email address of a user or group, or the name of a domain, depending on the scope type. Omitted for type `default`.

blocks.name: getAllACLs
blocks.description: Returns the rules in the access control list for the calendar.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: calendarId
args.info: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the `primary` keyword.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: Maximum number of entries returned on one result page. By default the value is 100 entries. The page size can never be larger than 250 entries. Works unstable.

args.name: pageToken
args.info: Token specifying which result page to return.

args.name: showDeleted
args.info: Whether to include deleted ACLs in the result. Deleted ACLs are represented by role equal to `none`. Deleted ACLs will always be included if syncToken is provided. Optional. The default is False.

args.name: syncToken
args.info: Token obtained from the nextSyncToken field returned on the last page of results from the previous list request.

blocks.name: updateACL
blocks.description: Updates an access control rule. This method supports patch semantics.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: calendarId
args.info: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the `primary` keyword.

args.name: ruleId
args.info: ACL rule identifier.

args.name: role
args.info: The role assigned to the scope. Possible values are: `none` - Provides no access. `freeBusyReader` - Provides read access to free/busy information. `reader` - Provides read access to the calendar. Private events will appear to users with reader access, but event details will be hidden. `writer` - Provides read and write access to the calendar. Private events will appear to users with writer access, and event details will be visible. `owner` - Provides ownership of the calendar. This role has all of the permissions of the writer role with the additional ability to see and manipulate ACLs.

args.name: scopeType
args.info: The type of the scope. Possible values are: `default` - The public scope. This is the default value. `user` - Limits the scope to a single user. `group` - Limits the scope to a group. `domain` - Limits the scope to a domain.

args.name: scopeValue
args.info: The email address of a user or group, or the name of a domain, depending on the scope type. Omitted for type `default`.

blocks.name: deleteCalendarList
blocks.description: Deletes an entry on the user's calendar list.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: calendarId
args.info: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the `primary` keyword.

blocks.name: getCalendarList
blocks.description: Returns an entry on the user's calendar list.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: calendarId
args.info: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the `primary` keyword.

blocks.name: createEntryToCalendarList
blocks.description: Adds an entry to the user's calendar list.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: defaultReminders
args.info: Default Reminders array

structure.name: method
structure.info: The method used by this reminder. Possible values are: email, sms, popup

structure.name: minutes
structure.info: Number of minutes before the start of the event when the reminder should trigger. Valid values are between 0 and 40320 (4 weeks in minutes).

args.name: id
args.info: Identifier of the calendar.

args.name: colorRgbFormat
args.info: Whether to use the foregroundColor and backgroundColor fields to write the calendar colors (RGB). If this feature is used, the index-based colorId field will be set to the best matching option automatically.

args.name: notifications
args.info: Notifications

structure.name: method
structure.info: The method used by this reminder. Possible values are: email, sms

structure.name: type
structure.info: The type of notification. Must be: `eventCreation`,`eventChange`,`eventCancellation`,`eventResponse`,`agenda`

args.name: backgroundColor
args.info: The main color of the calendar in the hexadecimal format `#0088aa`.

args.name: colorId
args.info: The color of the calendar.

args.name: defaultReminders
args.info: The default reminders that the authenticated user has for this calendar.

args.name: foregroundColor
args.info: The foreground color of the calendar in the hexadecimal format.

args.name: hidden
args.info: Whether the calendar has been hidden from the list.

args.name: selected
args.info: Whether the calendar content shows up in the calendar UI.

args.name: summaryOverride
args.info: The summary that the authenticated user has set for this calendar.

blocks.name: getCalendarListEntry
blocks.description: Returns entries on the user's calendar list.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: Maximum number of entries returned on one result page. By default the value is 100 entries. The page size can never be larger than 250 entries. Optional.

args.name: minAccessRole
args.info: The minimum access role for the user in the returned entries. Optional. The default is no restriction. Must be: freeBusyReader,owner,reader,writer

args.name: pageToken
args.info: Token specifying which result page to return.

args.name: showDeleted
args.info: Whether to include deleted calendar list entries in the result. Optional. The default is False.

args.name: showHidden
args.info: Whether to show hidden entries. Optional. The default is False.

args.name: syncToken
args.info: Token obtained from the nextSyncToken field returned on the last page of results from the previous list request.

args.name: defaultReminders

structure.info: Number of minutes before the start of the event when the reminder should trigger. Valid values are between 0 and 40320 (4 weeks in minutes).

args.name: colorRgbFormat
args.info: Whether to use the foregroundColor and backgroundColor fields to write the calendar colors (RGB). If this feature is used, the index-based colorId field will be set to the best matching option automatically.

args.name: notifications
args.info: Notifications

structure.name: method
structure.info: The method used by this reminder. Possible values are: email, sms

structure.name: type
structure.info: The type of notification. Must be: `eventCreation`,`eventChange`,`eventCancellation`,`eventResponse`,`agenda`

args.name: backgroundColor
args.info: The main color of the calendar in the hexadecimal format `#0088aa`.

blocks.name: clearCalendar
blocks.description: Clears a primary calendar. This operation deletes all events associated with the primary calendar of an account.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: calendarId
args.info: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the `primary` keyword.

blocks.name: deleteCalendar
blocks.description: Deletes a secondary calendar. Use calendars.clear for clearing all events on primary calendars.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: calendarId
args.info: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the `primary` keyword.

args.info: Calendar identifier. To retrieve calendar IDs call the calendarList.list method. If you want to access the primary calendar of the currently logged in user, use the `primary` keyword.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: summary
args.info: Title of the calendar.

args.name: description

args.name: etag
args.info: ETag of the resource.

args.name: kind

args.name: location

args.name: timeZone
args.info: The time zone of the calendar.

args.name: calendarId
args.info: Calendar identifier.

args.name: summary
args.info: Title of the calendar.

args.name: etag
args.info: ETag of the resource.

args.info: Type of the resource (`calendar#calendar`).

args.name: location
args.info: Geographic location of the calendar as free-form text.

args.name: timeZone
args.info: The time zone of the calendar.

blocks.name: getColorDefinitions
blocks.description: Returns the color definitions for calendars and events.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

blocks.name: deleteEvent
blocks.description: Deletes an event.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: calendarId
args.info: Calendar identifier.

args.name: eventId
args.info: Event identifier.

args.name: sendNotifications
args.info: Whether to send notifications about the deletion of the event. Boolean.

blocks.name: getEvent
blocks.description: Returns an event.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: calendarId
args.info: Calendar identifier.

args.name: eventId
args.info: Event identifier.

args.name: alwaysIncludeEmail
args.info: Whether to always include a value in the email field for the organizer, creator and attendees, even if no real email is available (i.e. a generated, non-working value will be provided). Boolean.

args.name: maxAttendees
args.info: The maximum number of attendees to include in the response. If there are more than the specified number of attendees, only the participant is returned.

args.name: timeZone
args.info: Time zone used in the response.

blocks.name: importEvent
blocks.description: Imports an event. This operation is used to add a private copy of an existing event to a calendar.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: calendarId
args.info: Calendar identifier.

args.name: eventObject
args.info: Event resources.

args.name: maxAttendees
args.info: The maximum number of attendees to include in the response. If there are more than the specified number of attendees, only the participant is returned.

args.name: sendNotifications
args.info: Whether to send notifications about the creation of the new event.

args.name: supportsAttachments
args.info: Whether API client performing operation supports event attachments.

blocks.name: getEventInstances
blocks.description: Returns instances of the specified recurring event.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: calendarId
args.info: Calendar identifier.

args.name: eventId
args.info: Recurring event identifier.

args.name: alwaysIncludeEmail
args.info: Whether to always include a value in the email field for the organizer, creator and attendees, even if no real email is available (i.e. a generated, non-working value will be provided). The use of this option is discouraged and should only be used by clients which cannot handle the absence of an email address value in the mentioned places. The default is False.

args.name: maxAttendees
args.info: The maximum number of attendees to include in the response. If there are more than the specified number of attendees, only the participant is returned.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: Maximum number of events returned on one result page. By default the value is 250 events. The page size can never be larger than 2500 events.

args.name: originalStart
args.info: The original start time of the instance in the result.

args.name: pageToken
args.info: Token specifying which result page to return.

args.name: showDeleted
args.info: Whether to include deleted events (with status equals `cancelled`) in the result. Cancelled instances of recurring events will still be included if singleEvents is False.

args.name: timeMax
args.info: Upper bound (exclusive) for an event's start time to filter by. The default is not to filter by start time. Must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset.

args.name: timeMin
args.info: Lower bound (inclusive) for an event's end time to filter by. The default is not to filter by end time. Must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset.

args.name: timeZone
args.info: Time zone used in the response. The default is the time zone of the calendar.

blocks.name: getCalendarEvents
blocks.description: Returns instances of the specified recurring event.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: calendarId
args.info: Calendar identifier.

args.name: alwaysIncludeEmail
args.info: Whether to always include a value in the email field for the organizer, creator and attendees, even if no real email is available (i.e. a generated, non-working value will be provided). The use of this option is discouraged and should only be used by clients which cannot handle the absence of an email address value in the mentioned places. The default is False.

args.name: iCalUID
args.info: Specifies event ID in the iCalendar format to be included in the response.

args.name: maxAttendees
args.info: The maximum number of attendees to include in the response. If there are more than the specified number of attendees, only the participant is returned.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: Maximum number of events returned on one result page. By default the value is 250 events. The page size can never be larger than 2500 events.

args.name: orderBy
args.info: The order of the events returned in the result. Must be: startTime, updated

args.name: pageToken
args.info: Token specifying which result page to return.

args.name: privateExtendedProperty
args.info: Extended properties constraint specified as propertyName=value. Matches only private properties. This parameter might be repeated multiple times to return events that match all given constraints.

args.name: query
args.info: Free text search terms to find events that match these terms in any field, except for extended properties.

args.name: sharedExtendedProperty
args.info: Extended properties constraint specified as propertyName=value. Matches only shared properties. This parameter might be repeated multiple times to return events that match all given constraints.

args.name: showDeleted
args.info: Whether to include deleted events (with status equals `cancelled`) in the result. Cancelled instances of recurring events will still be included if singleEvents is False.

args.name: showHiddenInvitations
args.info: Whether to include hidden invitations in the result.

args.name: singleEvents
args.info: Whether to expand recurring events into instances and only return single one-off events and instances of recurring events, but not the underlying recurring events themselves.

args.name: timeMax
args.info: Upper bound (exclusive) for an event's start time to filter by. The default is not to filter by start time. Must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset.

args.name: timeMin
args.info: Lower bound (inclusive) for an event's end time to filter by. The default is not to filter by end time. Must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset.

args.name: timeZone
args.info: Time zone used in the response. The default is the time zone of the calendar.

args.name: updatedMin
args.info: Lower bound for an event's last modification time (as a RFC3339 timestamp) to filter by.

blocks.name: moveEvent
blocks.description: Moves an event to another calendar, i.e. changes an event's organizer.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: calendarId
args.info: Calendar identifier.

args.name: eventId
args.info: Event identifier.

args.name: destination
args.info: Calendar identifier of the target calendar where the event is to be moved to.

args.name: sendNotifications
args.info: Whether to send notifications about the change of the event's organizer.

blocks.name: updateEvent
blocks.description: Updates an event. This method supports patch semantics.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: calendarId
args.info: Calendar identifier.

args.name: eventId
args.info: Event identifier.

args.name: alwaysIncludeEmail
args.info: Whether to always include a value in the email field for the organizer, creator and attendees, even if no real email is available (i.e. a generated, non-working value will be provided). The use of this option is discouraged and should only be used by clients which cannot handle the absence of an email address value in the mentioned places. The default is False.

args.name: maxAttendees
args.info: The maximum number of attendees to include in the response. If there are more than the specified number of attendees, only the participant is returned.

args.name: sendNotifications
args.info: Whether to send notifications about the change of the event's organizer.

args.name: supportsAttachments
args.info: Whether API client performing operation supports event attachments.

args.name: eventObject
args.info: Event resources.

blocks.name: createSimpleEvent
blocks.description: Updates an event. This method supports patch semantics.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: calendarId
args.info: Calendar identifier.

args.name: text
args.info: The text describing the event to be created.

args.name: sendNotifications
args.info: Whether to send notifications about the change of the event's organizer.

blocks.name: getFreebusyInformation
blocks.description: Returns free/busy information for a set of calendars.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: timeMax
args.info: Upper bound (exclusive) for an event's start time to filter by. The default is not to filter by start time. Must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset.

args.name: timeMin
args.info: Lower bound (inclusive) for an event's end time to filter by. The default is not to filter by end time. Must be an RFC3339 timestamp with mandatory time zone offset.

args.name: timeZone
args.info: Time zone used in the response. The default is the time zone of the calendar.

args.name: groupExpansionMax
args.info: Maximal number of calendar identifiers to be provided for a single group. An error will be returned for a group with more members than this value.

args.name: calendarExpansionMax
args.info: Maximal number of calendars for which FreeBusy information is to be provided.

args.name: items
args.info: List of calendars and/or groups to query.

structure.name: id
structure.info: The identifier of a calendar or a group.

blocks.name: getSingleUserSettings
blocks.description: Returns a single user setting.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: setting
args.info: The id of the user setting.

blocks.name: getAllSettings
blocks.description: Returns all user settings for the authenticated user.

args.name: accessToken
args.info: OAuth 2.0 token for the current user.

args.name: maxResults
args.info: Maximum number of entries returned on one result page. By default the value is 100 entries. The page size can never be larger than 250 entries. Works unstable.

args.name: pageToken
args.info: Token specifying which result page to return.
